thread.title: UFC Fight Night 103 live blog: Joe Lauzon vs. Marcin Held
thread.title_full: UFC Fight Night 103 live blog: Joe Lauzon vs. Marcin Held

author: Chuck Mindenhall
title: UFC Fight Night 103 live blog: Joe Lauzon vs. Marcin Held
text:
Joe Lauzon and Marcin Held will clash in the UFC Fight Night 103 co-main event. Getty Images 
This is the UFC Fight Night 103 live blog for Joe Lauzon vs. Marcin Held , a lightweight bout at Sunday night's UFC event at Talking Stick Resort Arena in Phoenix, Ariz. 
Joe Lauzon , who has won two of his last five UFC fights, will face Held , who is 0-1 in the UFC, on the main card. 
Check out the UFC Fight Night 103 live blog below. 
Round 1: The referee for this one is Herb Dean. They touch gloves. Held with leg kick, and waves a punch. Lauzon comes in and slams a couple of quick inside punches on him. Left jab from Held lands. That snapped fast, now Lauzon with a quick jump in, lands a sequence, and Lauzon with a series of elbows at the takedown attempt! That hurt Held. They break. Lauzon clinches, and they change positions on fence. Now Held with a well-earned takedown right there on the links, and he's fighting in Lauzon's guard. Now he moves Lauzon out from the fence towards the middle, and Lauzon tries to scramble. Short elbows from Held, who now moves to side control. Lauzon hanging tough down there, plenty active. Now Lauzon scrambles back to his feet, wall-walking to advantage. Held immediately to clinch, and he lowers for a double-leg. Held knows what side his bread is buttered on. They break, and with 40 seconds left they clinch again, with Lauzon the bully in the scenario. Held is deft at this, though, and reverses. Held holding him there, and at the end of the round Lauzon blasts Held with a shot that might have sent him reeling, and throws a good-measure shot at the horn. MMA Fighting scores R1 for Lauzon, 10-9. 
Round 2:
